intro: Pyrethrum kaghyzmanicum, commonly known as the Kaghyzman pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers. The plant produces fine, hair-like structures called trichomes, which contain pyrethrins—natural insecticides. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun for optimal growth. Due to its unique chemical composition, it has potential applications in organic pest control.
